channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: New York Governor sexually harassed women, report finds
item.description: The investigation comes months after several women accused Andrew Cuomo of sexual misconduct.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Bodies on the streets as fighting traps Lashkar Gah residents
item.description: Terrified locals are fleeing if they can as the Taliban and troops battle to control Lashkar Gah.

item.title: Warning of 'potential hijack' of ship under way off UAE coast
item.description: Unconfirmed reports say that armed men boarded a Panama-flagged tanker in the Gulf of Oman.

item.title: Vitaly Shishov: Head of Belarus exiles group found dead in Ukraine
item.description: Vitaly Shishov lived in Ukraine and led a group helping people who fled the Belarus crackdown.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Elaine Thompson-Herah completes unprecedented 'double-double'
item.description: Elaine Thompson-Herah confirms her place among the pantheon of sprint greats as she secures an unprecedented women's 100m-200m 'double-double' with a sensational victory over the longer distance in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: New Zealand's Laurel Hubbard set to 'hang up her boots'
item.description: The transgender weightlifter made Olympic history but says her time in the sport is probably up.

item.title: German pensioner given hefty fine for WW2 tank in house
item.description: The 82 year old is given a suspended sentence and fined €250,000 (£213,469).

item.title: Chinese gold medallists face investigation over Mao badges
item.description: The cyclists appeared on the podium wearing the badges in a potential breach of Olympic rules.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Bodies wash up in Sudan's border river
item.description: The corpses had gunshot wounds and hands tied behind their backs, a doctor tells the BBC.

item.title: Neanderthal markings in Spain suggest cave art, study says
item.description: Red stains found in caves in Spain were created more than 60,000 years ago, researchers say.

item.title: Vauhxx Booker: Black man condemns charges over alleged race attack
item.description: Vauhxx Booker, who alleges two white men threatened to lynch him, is himself charged with assault.

item.title: Belarus sprinter Krystina Timanovskaya says protest is not political
item.description: Olympian Krystina Timanovskaya tells the BBC she would like to return home "when I know it's safe".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chinese nationalists turn on their athletes
item.description: To ultra-nationalists online, losing an Olympic medal is being "unpatriotic", experts say.

item.title: Covid third wave: Americans 'scared and angry' as pandemic worsens
item.description: As the Delta variant causes a rethink about risk, Americans are battling to keep a feeling of normalcy.

item.title: West faces dilemmas over tanker attack
item.description: A drone attack on a ship off the coast of Oman has worsened already strained ties with Iran.

item.title: Covid-19: The mystery of rising infections in India's Kerala
item.description: Covid-19 cases continue to rise in Kerala despite the waning of the second wave elsewhere in India.

item.title: Ethiopia: Growing concerns for unity as Tigray conflict spreads
item.description: The nine-month-long conflict in Tigray has spread, with little hope of peace talks taking place soon.

item.title: F1's Esteban Ocon: How it feels winning your first Formula 1 race
item.description: The 24-year-old Frenchman pulled off a huge F1 shock by winning the Hungarian Grand Prix

item.title: Ever Given: Ship docks in Felixstowe after Suez Canal delay
item.description: The Ever Given reaches UK shores after being delayed when it ran aground in the Suez Canal, Egypt.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals – and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: Covid vaccine inequity 'completely unacceptable and unethical'
item.description: Rich countries need to do more to give vaccines to poor countries, says top WHO adviser Helen Clark.

item.title: 'The reason I'm doing this is because I was inspired by him'
item.description: Karim al-Jian was inspired to study medicine, after learning about a doctor who was killed helping civilians in Syria.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Round-up of the action from Day 11
item.description: Elaine Thompson-Herah makes sprint history and hurdler Karsten Warholm smashes a world record on the day Simone Biles wins bronze on an emotional return to Olympic competition.

item.title: Simone Biles wins Tokyo Olympics beam bronze on emotional return
item.description: Simone Biles wins bronze in the beam final in an emotional return to Olympic gymnastics competition.

item.title: Australian athletes 'damaged beds and rooms'
item.description: Australian athletes damaged beds in their Olympic village hotel rooms and put a hole in a wall before leaving, the country's Olympic committee says.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sifan Hassan takes 5,000m gold in first leg of attempted treble
item.description: Sifan Hassan takes 5,000m gold as she bids for an unprecedented Olympic treble on the track in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Serhiy Kulish eliminated after shooting at rival's target
item.description: Ukraine's Serhiy Kulish gets distracted by a wardrobe malfunction and shoots at his rival's target.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Giles Scott wins Finn class, gold in men's 49er & silver in mixed Nacra 17
item.description: Great Britain win two golds and a silver on a thrilling day in sailing at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.
